p: ZIKV infection during pregnancy has been linked to several complications, which are collectively referred to as congenital Zika syndrome. These include miscarriage, severe microcephaly, and other fetal brain defects, lasting tissue damage in brain, eye damage [ 20, 21]. Another complication of ZIKV infection is its association with the Guillain–Barré syndrome (GBS), a neurological disorder [ 22, 23].
